Description: Rim sherd of South Ionian pottery chalice-cup; interior: reserved band at top of rim, glazed black below; exterior: two black bands at top of rim, above series of dilute lines; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see British Museum 1886,0401.329. Such sherds have been identified as kantharoi by some scholars and as chalice cups by others. The horizontal handle usually found suggests that these are chalice cups. According to Schlotzhauer (2012, 115) , althoug locally madh chalices are now known from the excavations at Miletus, nothing similar to the Naukratis type is as yet known.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.733) (phase 3)
